Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of the pens, stating they cost "$2,025 per pen" when in reality they cost just under $15 each.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or sources to support the cost of the pens. The only mention of the price comes from a flagged Facebook post without any other mentions or corroborating sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the pens actually cost just under $15 each, as confirmed by Pelosi's deputy chief of staff.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the cost of the pens was paid for by taxpayers, without providing any evidence or proof of this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim implies that Pelosi delayed sending the Articles of Impeachment to the Senate in order to wait for her "gold-plated impeachment pens," but there is no evidence or alternative explanation provided to support this claim.
